description.plain:
Charlie Puth is an American singer-songwriter who started by making and covering songs on his YouTube channel. His big break came when he was featured on the Furious 7 song “See You Again,” which he had written for a friend who passed away in a similar accident. The song reached #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and stayed there for twelve weeks, becoming the longest-running rap number one along with Eminem’s “Lose Yourself.” The song’s iconic music video was also the most viewed video on all of YouTube for a short amount of time when it passed PSY’s “Gangnam Style” in July 2017.

His first project, The Otto Tunes, was released in 2010, with the title being a play on his middle name, Otto, and autotune. His second release, Ego, was also self-produced and dropped in October 2013.

His major-label debut Nine Track Mind was released January 29, 2016, and lead single “Marvin Gaye” with Meghan Trainor topped the charts in the UK and reached the top twenty-five in the US, peaking at #21. His next single “One Call Away” fared even better, hitting #12 in the US and establishing Puth as a full-blown star as opposed to a two-hit wonder. A deluxe edition of the record was released in November 2016.

The next year saw the release of “Attention” and eventually Voicenotes, Charlie’s second studio album.

Puth has what is known as perfect pitch, the ability to identify a note by ear. This talent allowed him to step in for a church organist and played all of the songs that were part of the service from memory.

description.plain:
In “Attention,” Charlie expresses his encounters with an ex-girlfriend who’s trying to tempt him to come back to her by playing with his emotions, though he knows she is just looking for attention and isn’t interested in a permanent relationship. The song was released as the lead single from Puth’s second studio album, Voicenotes.

To promote this single, Puth opened an exhibit named “The Attention Room” on Melrose Avenue, Los Angeles which featured a LED infinity tunnel, further emphasizing the song’s theme of attention.

description.plain:
Charlie Puth does another love duet with Selena Gomez, this time bemoaning the regrets after a breakup.

“We Don’t Talk Anymore” is the second single from Nine Track Mind. The song was teased by Puth on his Instagram, a little over a month before its release.

Charlie talked about the song’s inception in an interview with MTV, saying:

I wrote [“We Don’t Talk Anymore”] in Japan, I was in my hotel room, at the Mandarin Hotel, looking out at this wonderful city from the top floor, and I called my guitarist who was in the next room and I said, ’Dude, can you come to my room really quickly and play this guitar line?’ I didn’t have a microphone, so I recorded his guitar with my iPhone, and I put it in the mix. Then, we went to the Philippines the next day, and I put the kick drum in.

description.plain:
“How Long,” the second single from Charlie’s sophomore album, Voicenotes, sees Charlie apologizing to a girl for being unfaithful. Charlie teased the track on social media in the week leading up to its release, and posted a video of the voice note behind the track the night before it came out.

In an interview with Ryan Seacrest released the day after this song dropped, Charlie discussed the similarities between this track and his previous single, “Attention”:

With the theme of ‘Attention’ kinda being a ‘bass’ song, I didn’t want it to be, like, a ripoff of ‘Attention,’ but lyrically, the song is like part two of ‘Attention,’ as far as the story goes. I’ll leave that up to interpretation.

As of the week of Feb. 2, 2018, “How Long” peaked at #21 on Billboard’s Hot 100 chart.

description.plain:
Charlie Puth embraces the ability to call his beloved in “One Call Away”, the lead single of his debut album, Nine Track Mind. (Songs from his EP Some Type Of Love were included on the album as well.)

Structurally, it’s a light ballad, featuring no synth production of any kind. MTV called it an instantly catchy tune.

description.plain:
“Done for Me” is the fourth single from Charlie’s sophomore album Voicenotes. Charlie teased the track on Instagram the day before it was released. The song was officially released on March 15, 2018 after an interview on Radio Beats 1.
In the interview, Puth explained how the 1980s-inspired song came together:

I produced this [record] after an unsuccessful party in L.A., which is what all these records are based off… I have my little Juno keyboard… I just hit one of these settings here and played a B minor chord. It just made me think of Wham! It made me think of 1988. I put that chord down and I immediately thought of Kehlani.

The song sees Charlie collaborating with Kehlani in the last part of the story started with “Attention” and “How Long.” In the song, we witness the final apology between the boy and the girl, on equal terms, played by Charlie and Kehlani.

description.plain:
“The Way I Am" is the sixth single released from Charlie’s sophomore album VoiceNotes. The song was confirmed as the next single in an Instagram post dated July 6th, 2018.

On March 17, 2018, Puth announced the song title in an interview on Beats 1. On April 23, 2018, Charlie Puth teased the song on Instagram with a cryptic comment under his photo, saying “and now… this is the way I am. ”

On May 11, 2018, Puth talked about the record on the Zach Sang Show and what it meant for him both personally and artistically, saying:

When See You Again was out and I was trying to figure out who I was musically and I was putting all these songs out and they didn’t really sound like each other and I was trying to be someone that I wasn’t. Even outside of music I thought ‘Oh, I’m a pop singer. I have to act a certain way, I have to talk a certain way.’ I fell victim to that and I always told myself that if success ever hit me, that would not happen to me but that exact same thing, probably 10 times more, had happened to me. The Way I Am starts off the album with the self-realisation that I don’t need to go out every night, I don’t need to surround myself with ‘yes-men/women’, I can just be around my family and people that I’m close to. I’m not inventing this lingo, this is just stuff that people need to realise in their own lives as well so I really was very passionate about the album starting off with that lyrical sentiment.

description.plain:
“Light Switch” is the lead single from Charlie Puth’s upcoming third album Charlie.

Charlie Puth first shared “Light Switch” on his TikTok on September 16, 2021, showing the production of the song and gained over 20 million views in less than 24 hours. On September 17, 2021, Puth shared another TikTok continuing to show the production of the song teasing a few more lyrics of the song along with a pre-save link, stating if it got 500,000 pre-saves, he’d release it.

Puth had hinted towards the song since May 27, 2021, putting the lightbulb emoji in his bio on his social media and tweeting it on Twitter several times.

On January 18, 2022, Charlie Puth revealed the artwork for “Light Switch” via Instagram and Twitter. The song was released alongside its music video on January 20, 2022.

description.plain:
“If You Leave Me Now” is the third single from Charlie Puth’s sophomore album VoiceNotes, following “Attention” and “How Long.” It is the first album single with a feature.

The song is an R&B-influenced a cappella ballad, urging a significant other not to walk out on the relationship.

In a tweet, Charlie mentioned the relationship between “If You Leave Me Now” and his previous hits “Attention” and “How Long” here.

description.plain:
The second song on Nine Track Mind illustrates going through with a relationship, knowing that it could be destroyed by the love and life of their actions.

Charlie explains in an iHeart Radio interview:

‘Dangerously’ [is] kind of on the same vein as ‘My Gospel’, of loving someone to the utmost amount, but taking it to a ridiculous level. Kind of like Bruno Mars' ‘Grenade’, like, ‘I’ll catch a grenade for you,’ but um, not biting that of course, but thinking of what’s the craziest thing you could think of just to love somebody.

description.plain:
“Cheating On You” is the third single off of Charlie Puth’s 2019 album, SICK.

On the track, Charlie questions his decision to leave his partner, concluding that he is still attached to her.

The catchy hip-hop beat featuring a soft flute was first constructed by Charlie on Instagram in January, 2019.

description.plain:
The original version of the smash hit of the same name. A few years after writing the track, Charlie was approached by the team behind Furious 7 and picked up an offer that would later jumpstart his career: featuring his song, with added verses from Wiz Khalifa, in the film.

Despite popular belief, “See You Again” is not about Paul Walker — although the newer version is dedicated to him, Charlie wrote the song after the death of a friend.

On June 11, 2016, Charlie sang this during his concert at BLI Summer Jam at Jones Beach Theatre for his late friend Christina Grimmie, who has been shot and killed during her concert at Orlando, Florida. During his “See You Again” performance, he states the following:

“I want to dedicate this song to her tonight. And I’ve been upset about this all day, mainly because I just never got to say what I wanted to say and I feel like this song perfectly captures that and if anyone here who’s ever lost anybody, it perfectly captures that. And I`ll quit talking because I feel right away.”

He then states that: “Bodies die, but our souls live forever.”

On February 2020, Charlie, along with Wiz Khalifa, performed this as a tribute for former basketball player, Kobe Bryant, and his daughter, Gianna “Gigi” Bryant, who both died from a helicopter crash.

description.plain:
Charlie Puth first shared “That’s Hilarious” on his TikTok on October 12, 2021 while in the studio, showing the production of the song.

On February 14, 2022 after finishing the song, Charlie shared in his TikTok,

When I listen to it, it brings me back to the hardest time in my life when I couldn’t let somebody go. It makes me sad, which I never am on here, but I hope you love it. Don’t give your heart to someone who’s still got a broken one.

On March 23, 2022 Charlie announced on TikTok “That’s Hilarious” being the second single off his third-studio album, Charlie. In his TikTok, Charlie expressed,

I’m really excited for the song to come out but, you know, every time I hear it, I’m kind of brought back to a time that was really, really challenging in my life.

description.plain:
“Patient” is track number 6 and one of the songs  from Charlie’s sophomore album Voicenotes. Puth revealed the name of the song replying to a comment from a fan on Instagram.

The song, carries on the terminal part of the “love story”, that runs through the entire album by Charlie Puth. We witness, this way, the phase of regret of the boy, who apologizes for all his mistakes to the girl. In this sense, it also seems to be a direct link to “How Long”, in which the girl accused the partner of betrayal.

Initially it was thought that it would be released at the beginning of March 2018, but his release took place on 11 May 2018, with the rest of his album.

The singer teased the song even on Twitter: on April 8, 2018 Puth published a tweet and immediately deleted it.
He wrote:

Db7 (b9) to F # min7 on a Rhodes



A clear reference to the video of “Patient”, directed by Colin Tilley, in which Charlie Puth plays the song with a Fender Rhodes piano.

description.plain:
“I Warned Myself” is Charlie Puth’s first song released in 2019, after releasing his hit album Voicenotes in 2018.

On August 19, Charlie Puth announced the song on his social networks, with the cover photo.

Charlie Puth wrote about the song on his social networks.

“I Warned Myself” is about a vicious cycle of going back to someone continuously, knowing deep down that they aren’t any good for you.

description.plain:
“Change”, a collaboration with James Taylor, is track number 10 of Voicenotes.
On Instagram, Charlie said:

James Taylor is the reason why I write music. I can’t believe I have a song with him now.

He gave an acoustic sneak peek of the song in a livestream on March 23 and announced the upcoming release for that exact day.
He debuted the song on March 24, 2018 during the “March For Our Lives” event.

It’s about everybody, as humans we all help each other and that song came about through collaboration. So if people at that march on Saturday see me perform that song…hopefully something inspirational will come out of them where they leave that march that day when they leave all that big vibe of inspiration and they’re back in the city life where people are pretty self consumed with what they’re doing, they’re going to take that with them. This is the most important song I ever wrote.

The song is about Charlie who just got out of a relationship seeking someone better in Los Angeles, but ends up regretting breaking up in the first place because the women in LA would only remind him how much he actually loved the girl he left.

body.plain:
“LA Girls” was released with the rest of Charlie Puth’s album Voicenotes on May 11th, 2018.

The song is about Charlie who just got out of a relationship seeking someone better in Los Angeles, but ends up regretting breaking up in the first place because the women in LA would only remind him how much he actually loved the girl he left.

“Suffer" embodies the concept of being infatuated; the wanting of releasing sexual tension, to the extent where a person becomes desperate to obtain this “love.“ He compares this infatuation to being “caught under a spell.”

On February 19, 2016, Charlie released a remix with features from Vince Staples & AndreaLo.

description.plain:
“Girlfriend” sees Charlie question a girl as to whether she’d want to be his girlfriend in the future. In the song, Charlie uses many elements from his music style with his soft, falsetto voice.

According to Charlie’s post:

The song is about being persistent and letting someone know that your feelings for them aren’t going to just go away. But rather, they’re always going to be there, and you can’t sleep another night until you have that person by your side every day.

It marks Charlie Puth’s first solo single of 2020 and the lead single of his third studio album.

The song was initially confirmed to be released on June 9, 2020. However, due to his focus with the #BlackLivesMatter movement, the song was delayed until June 25, 2020, with a teaser being shared four days prior to the release date. On June 22, 2020, the song accidentally leaked in full on Twitter from a now-deleted account. Charlie officially dropped the song on June 25, 2020 at 10AM PT.

description.plain:
This song is the last song of Charlie’s sophomore album. He said in an interview on the Zach Sang Show:

The last song, the vocals were recorded in this Marriott Hotel in Ohio when I was on tour a couple of years ago. The reason why that song sounds so different from Track 1 [The Way I Am] is because that Track 13 [Through It All] was supposed to be the sound of the album, however Attention came out and my whole sound completely changed.

description.plain:
For the remix of his top twenty hit “One Call Away”, Charlie Puth enlists rapper Tyga to drop a verse featuring Drake references and throwbacks to being poor.

The song was released on October 23, 2015. Interestingly, the original song didn’t reach its chart peak of #12 until March 5, 2016. Regardless of whether the remix helped the original’s popularity, it’s still there—and catchy.

description.plain:
This song is about someone that would do anything to conquer the love of the girl he loves. Charlie said in an interview:

I wrote it with the guy who wrote, ‘I dug my key into the side of his pretty little souped up four wheel drive,’ Josh Kear, brilliant writer. I just wanted to write a song about the pain and desperation of doing absolutely anything for a girl, female, anybody. I wanted to relay that message musically, and a lot of people could probably feel the same way when they hear it. It has a nice little beat to it.

description.plain: Look At Me Now is the first song of his self-produced album Ego (2013). After being invited on the Ellen Show and being signed to Ellen’s eleveneleven record label, Charlie Puth finally sees hope in his success in music. He used to be bullied as a kid for his shyness and his perfect pitch ability, and girls would often turn him down. But since he has now become famous, after appearance on The Ellen Show, he writes this song for those past bullies and girls who have turned him down, telling them to “look at me now”. We see a growth in his confidence and self esteem.

description.plain:
“Losing My Mind” is the last record that Charlie wrote for the album Nine Track Mind. He was getting pressure to finish the album.

He stated in an interview:

I had 12 hours to finish it, and I was kind of having a mental breakdown because I couldn’t think of anything. I thought I was losing my mind, and I didn’t know what to write about. And I stopped myself and I was like, ‘Dummy, why don’t you just write about what you’re feeling right now? You’re losing your mind.

description.plain:
In “As You Are”, which is Track 11 on Nine Track Mind, Charlie Puth explains to his lover that he would do practically anything for her, and loves her for who she is. He says a little more on this here:

‘As You Are.’ I will take you as you are, if you want to wear grey sweatpants and eat Chinese food with me at 2:00 o'clock in the morning on a Friday night, that’s totally fine. Doesn’t that sound fun? At Charlie’s house you always end up on the couch, eating Chinese food. Not even Netflix and chill, just Jerry Springer and television ads, infomercials, blue and white lights shining upon us as we eat the sesame chicken.

description.plain:
“Up All Night” is about having trouble with someone else not reciprocating their feelings. Puth told iHeartRadio that he wrote this with Bonnie McKee:

‘Up All Night’ I wrote with Bonnie McKee, who writes all of Katy’s [Perry] stuff, and is incredible. I was talking with Bonnie, who was going through a tough time with this guy wanting [him] to like her, and I didn’t tell her that I was having a tough time with this girl wanting to like me, and it was the first time that I’ve been in a session where two people were both experiencing the same feeling, but didn’t tell each other, but we found it out through music. So that’s pretty cool. That song came together really quickly too.

description.plain:
In an interview with iHeart Radio, Charlie gives us a little more on “Then There’s You”:

‘Then There’s You’ is a record I worked on with Max Martin, who is like the Pop God of the world. I needed to have one pop-y record on this album. I grew up listening to Backstreet Boys and *NSYNC, and I couldn’t have a debut album without having something done by Max Martin. I was so happy he jumped on this. ‘There’s beautiful and then there’s you, not being able to find the word, there’s no words to express when you’re wearing that dress that way, there’s no words to express let me look in your eyes and say there’s beautiful and then there’s you.’ You can’t find the word to say it.

description.plain:
Me & U was first teased by Charlie Puth when replying to a now deleted TikTok comment with “me&u.” He later teased lyrics to the song on September 14, 2020 on Twitter and September 22, 2020 he shared the instrumental with fans not knowing it was the songs instrumental on TikTok with the sound being titled “November.” Charlie officially posted a snippet on Instagram with the song title as the caption.

Prior to the release on October 21, 2020, Charlie shared on his TikTok. how he created the production of the song.

Charlie confirmed on his Instagram livestream on October 16, 2020 while playing the melody of Me & U that fans will be hearing the song in January of 2021.

description.plain: Continuing with the rap remixes after “Marvin Gaye” and “One Call Away”, Charlie dropped a brand new version of “Suffer” on February 19, 2016. With the help of AndreaLo, the song was given a whole new sound, as well as a new verse from Vince Staples.

description.plain:
The song was first shared by Charlie Puth on his deleted TikTok video on March 19, 2021. He captioned the video stating,

Since everyone keeps asking how the new album is sounding- spam comments if you want this!!!

The title was later seen on Charlie’s Instagram story when he was in the studio on June 28, 2021. On July 1, 2021, the song was played on Charlie’s story then posted to his Instagram Reel of Travis Barker playing the drums with the caption,

I’m not usually a fan of leaking snippets of songs before they’re out, but holy fuck
@travisbarker ….

On December 6, 2021 Charlie posted a TikTok of the song receiving over 4.5 million views in less than 15 hours of it being posted. When asked what the song is called he responded revealing the track as, “HER.”

description.plain:
The title is currently unconfirmed and based on common/repeated words featured in the snippet

“First Time” was first shared on Charlie Puth’s TikTok on November 3rd, 2021 showing the production making of the song. He stated in his TikTok video that the song is about being with someone that you never thought you would be with. Prior to the TikTok, Puth tweeted on October 30th,

Eh! Maybe there’s a first time for everything

On November 3rd, while in the studio during a TikTok livestream, Puth played new lyrics from “First Time” while playing songs from his album that he was working on.

On February 8, 2022, Charlie shared more of the song on TikTok and Instagram livestream while mixing the album in the studio.

Jungkook had previously released a cover of “We Don’t Talk Anymore” plus a duet cover with Jimin.

description.plain:
See you again – Piano Demo version is a version that Charlie Puth wrote in honor of his friend who had died in a car accident, it was later adpated into the version used in Fast and Furious 7.

According to InStyle, Puth flew to L.A. for a business after signing a deal with Atlantic Records, he wrote the hook to the song on his day two there. It was a complete turn of the tables when the producers picked the song for the Fast and Furious 7 movie:

It was the first time I knew I wanted to be artist Charlie, not just producer and songwriter Charlie."

Coincidently, Puth’s friend died in a similar way to that of Paul Walker’s death. Puth says of the song, which made it very matching for the Fast and Furious 7 movie:

My friend, who got me through a lot of hard times, suddenly passes away and it’s a really, really sad moment for me. I’ve never lost anybody like that…"

description.plain:
Charlie and Emily wrote this with Robert Gillies in December 2011 at Charlie’s apartment in Boston. Charlie brought a framework for the first verse and half chorus to Robert & Emily who helped finish it the same day, and they released it with an original music video before the end of the year.

The three of them went on to perform the song on Ellen as a web exclusive, celebrating Charlie and Emily’s signing to Ellen’s then record label Eleveneleven.

The song was removed from iTunes and Charlie official YouTube channel shortly before his performance career was rebooted with ‘See You Again’ in 2014.

description.plain:
“Holding Me Back” is an unfinished song by Charlie Puth that was shared on an Instagram Live with Jacob Collier on December 4, 2020 that he created that morning. The lyrics are unfinished to the song.

Charlie Puth stated while sharing the song in a Instagram Livestream,

I got out of something last year where I was around the wrong kind of person and felt like they were holding me back. And I thought I was not [putting] as good enough music out. They were like holding me back from achieving real great life things.

description.plain:
This is the original version of the song “Nothing But Trouble” (feat. Lil Wayne ), released by Charlie Puth when he was still working independently.

After he signed to the actual record label, he had to remove all of his original songs from YouTube and, at a later time, he recorded the new version of this song with Wayne.

Two years later, Puth also released a dance remix of the original song, in his debut album “Nine Track Mind Deluxe”.

description.plain:
“Know You By Heart” is an unreleased song by Charlie Puth. The track was leaked March 3rd, 2019 and, according to Puth, is around 5 years old. It was likely meant to be on one of his previous albums but ended up on the cutting room floor.

The singer tweeted shortly after the track was leaked:

I really wish people would stop leaking my shit from like 5 years ago…please don’t think that THATS new music. Because it’s not. Very disappointin

https://twitter.com/charlieputh/status/1102373432291815426

The track then, is particularly noteworthy for being the only one officially published by Puth after the “restart” of his musical career. All the remaining 27 in fact, have been obscured to the new public and the numerous music cover, cancelled.

Charlie Puth published the snippet on his Instagram profile on January 20th.
The caption says that the song is dedicated to Paris that is still mourning over the attacks that took place in November.

The song is a piano ballad and could be added to his debut album “Nine Track Mind” set to drop on November 29th.

Charlie Puth wrote this jingle as part of a promotional campaign for the return of Subway’s $5 Footlongs.

Subway responded to the Tweet saying “We might have to after that… well done!”

description.plain:
“Know Your Name” should have been the fifth song of Charlie Puth’s debut album, “Nine Track Mind”. Subsequently however the tracklist has been modified and the song has been replaced.
Basically it is thought that it should have been a remake of the old “Your Name (The Ukulele Song)” produced by Puth in the years of its musical independence, using it as a filler for the upcoming album.
But later, the release date was postponed and the singer had more time to add new songs.

description.plain:
After the great “L.U.V.”, Charlie Puth makes his return with another promo single (now another one Unreleased): “Chop Like This”.
The perfect soundtrack to a breezy summer romance, this cut sees the indie phenom showcasing his skills on both sides of the mixing boards. Puth’s own steamy synths and windchimes accompany him as he spits falsetto-laced game to a lucky woman. Emily Warren provides spoken ad-libs throughout the record.

description.plain:
Charlie Puth published the snippet on his Instagram profile on January 20th 2015.
The caption says that the song is dedicated to Paris that is still mourning over the attacks that took place in November.

The song is a piano ballad and it could be adhave been included to his debut album “Nine Track Mind” set to drop on November 29thbut it did not happen that way.

In fact, after a few years, May 4, 2018 the song is completed but is not released by Puth, but by Marshmello, with the title “You Can Cry”. Then the chorus, written by Charlie Puth, is not known for what reason, is sung by James Arthur.

body.plain: A meme song made by Charlie Puth sometime in 2010 before he became a signed artist. He debuted this song on YouTube when he was a teenager not knowing who he would become when he got older.

description.plain:
Charlie Puth made a TikTok challenge asking all the singers, rappers, etc on the app to duet his song. Theofficalkristylee was one of the duetters and if you go on the youtube vid link the first part of her TikTok starts at 0:27 and ends at 0:54. These are the lyrics to her duet.

link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ASay7BmnkU0

description.plain: My Pizza is a parody of “My Moment” by Rebecca Black. The song is about Charlie Puth and an unknown person. Charlie doesn’t want his dinner so he orders pizza, and proclaims that it is his and only his. (The one I used for the link is the re-uploaded version).
